definition: Zhonghua Zihai, the most comprehensive Chinese character dictionary with 85,568 entries, compiled in 1994
to hit (the mark)/to be hit by/to suffer/to win (a prize, a lottery)
Mt Hua 華山|华山 in Shaanxi/surname Hua
letter/symbol/character/word/CL:個|个[ge4]/courtesy or style name traditionally given to males aged 20 in dynastic China
ocean/sea/CL:個|个[ge4],片[pian4]/great number of people or things/(dialect) numerous
Hanyu Da Zidian, one of the most comprehensive Chinese character dictionaries with 54,678 (and later 60,370) entries, first published between 1986-1990
Hanyu Da Cidian, the largest Chinese dictionary, with over 375,000 word entries, first published 1986-1994
the Kangxi Dictionary, named after the Kangxi Emperor, who in 1710 ordered its compilation, containing 47,035 single-character entries
four corner code (input method for Chinese characters)
Leipian, Chinese character dictionary with 31,319 entries, compiled by Sima Guang 司馬光|司马光[Si1 ma3 Guang1] et al in 11th century
see 龍龕手鑑|龙龛手鉴[Long2 kan1 Shou3 jian4]
